item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "So live as if you were living already for the second time and as if you had acted the first time as wrongly as you are about to act now!" -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked. In a word, each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Charlotte BrontÃ«
item.description: "But life is a battle: may we all be enabled to fight it well!" -- Charlotte BrontÃ«

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by John Bytheway
item.description: "Say no to asphalt!" -- John Bytheway

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Stephen R. Covey
item.description: "Through imagination, we can visualize the uncredited worlds of potential that lie within us." -- Stephen R. Covey

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "I ask you, what good is a big picture window and the lavish appointments and a priceless decor in a home if there is no mother there?" -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "We learn to do by doing." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Remember who you are and what God expects you to become." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Stick to a task 'til it sticks to you. . .for beginners are many, but finishers few." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul" -- Victor Hugo

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: The Pike family add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come." -- Victor Hugo
